name: Hardware Installation Engineer
description:
Hardware Installation Engineer will work within a designated territory in Russia and Central Asia but can also expect some travel within the EMEA region or worldwide; it is estimated that each site install will take up to 4 weeks and thus overall travel is high (up to 80%). In this challenging yet rewarding position, you will install our radiotherapy equipment at our customers facilities and work directly with the end user during installation and acceptance.

Specification:

You are customer service and team-oriented and have a proactive attitude with excellent organizational skills. You can work independently as well as a part of a team. You thrive in managing numerous tasks accurately and simultaneously in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. You will also be interested in learning and developing by taking advantage of Varians’ encouraging and high resourceful culture.

Responsibilities:

  • Installs and upgrades specific Varian Medical Systems (VMS) products according to technical documentation provided.
  • Instructs customers in basic operation and basic maintenance of VMS products.
  • Advises customers in safety and emergency procedures.
  • Reports by means of FSR’s / time sheets / expense reports / installation reports etc. (as applicable) regularly / weekly to ensure accurate company statistical data on customer-oriented activities is available / maintained up to date.
  • Inputs detailed records of installation and upgrade work performed into company information systems, including technical problems, actions taken, and parts employed to correct these problems.
  • Maintains up-to-date technical documentation, in order to permanently keep informed regarding all operating characteristics, design factors, technical performance and development of VMS products to improve installation efficiency.
  • Maintains a high degree of professional knowledge and safety consciousness according to VMS guidelines.
  • Willingness for extensive global travel (Pandemic Allowing; 80% / Duration of each trip, approx. 1- 4 weeks)

Qualifications & Experience

Essential:

  • Graduate of a Technical Institute or University in electronics, electrical / biomedical engineering or related fields or equivalent education.
  • Knowledge of and sound professional technical experience with mechanics and PC based systems.
  • Sound knowledge of processes and methods such as product specification, product developments / expansions and product security and safety plus professional experience of electronic and mechanical testing equipment used for verification, checkout and calibration of VMS products.
  • Fluency in English language, both written and spoken.

Desired:

  • Experience working at Hardware Installation Engineer from Medical Devices company.
